metadata.feature_description: Delete templates from the system with confirmation dialog, except default templates

steps.expected: Page Templates list should be displayed
steps.actual: Page Templates page loaded with 6 templates displayed in a grid view

steps.action: Click on 'Test Settings Template' to select it
steps.expected: Template should be selected with Edit and Delete buttons visible
steps.actual: Template selected with Edit and Delete action buttons visible

steps.action: Click the Delete button on the selected template
steps.expected: Confirmation dialog should appear asking to confirm deletion
steps.actual: Confirmation dialog appeared with message 'Please confirm you wish to delete this template.' with Cancel and Delete buttons

steps.action: With confirmation dialog open, click Cancel button
steps.expected: Dialog should close and template should remain in the list
steps.actual: Dialog closed and all 6 templates remained in the list - no deletion occurred

steps.action: Click Delete button on 'Test Settings Template'
steps.actual: Confirmation dialog appeared with message 'Please confirm you wish to delete this template.'

steps.action: Click Delete button in confirmation dialog
steps.expected: Template should be deleted from the system
steps.actual: Template was successfully deleted - 'Test Settings Template' removed from the list

steps.expected: Deleted template should no longer appear in the list
steps.actual: Template list updated immediately - now shows 5 templates instead of 6, 'Test Settings Template' is no longer visible

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify default template cannot be deleted

steps.action: Click on 'Cavalier - Main' template (default template using default skin)
steps.expected: Template should be selected, but Delete button should not be available
steps.actual: Template was selected and only Edit button is visible - Delete button is NOT present

observations: The default template ('Cavalier - Main') using the default skin does not display a Delete button, effectively preventing deletion
Non-default templates show both Edit and Delete buttons when selected
The confirmation dialog provides clear messaging about the deletion action
The template list updates immediately after successful deletion without requiring a page refresh
The preview panel can overlap with template cards but action buttons remain functional
